intro: Battandiera seineri, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features bright yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
